title: How to Use the Hue Tool on MediBang Paint Pro
category_hierarchy: Digital Technology Art and Craft Projects

steps.headline: Open MediBang.
steps.description: Load up whatever drawing you want the hue to change. If you don't have something already drawn, draw it now.

steps.headline: Press Ctrl+U on your keyboard to access the hue, brightness, and saturation menu on MediBang.
steps.description: Whatever default hue you already have will always be zero. When we change the hue, the new saved hue will become zero. The hue slider is the top bar in the HSB menu.

steps.headline: Move the slider on the hue bar.
steps.description: It ranges from -180 to 180, with zero as your starting point. Choose a point, wait a moment, and the image will take on a new hue. The hue bar works similar to a color wheel. Red fades into orange on one side, and then to yellow. On the other side, it fades into purple, blue, cyan, and so on. Because of this, the two endpoints, -180 and 180 will be almost the same hue.

steps.headline: Keep changing the slider until you have found a hue that you like.
steps.description: Click okay on the HSB menu to save. The HSB menu will close after you press okay, but you can open it again with Ctrl+U.

steps.headline: Allow the picture to change its hue.
steps.description: The image itself should retain the hue that you chose, and the navigation window and layers will update as well.

text: Open MediBang. Load up whatever drawing you want the hue to change. If you don't have something already drawn, draw it now. Press Ctrl+U on your keyboard to access the hue, brightness, and saturation menu on MediBang. Whatever default hue you already have will always be zero. When we change the hue, the new saved hue will become zero. The hue slider is the top bar in the HSB menu. Move the slider on the hue bar. It ranges from -180 to 180, with zero as your starting point. Choose a point, wait a moment, and the image will take on a new hue. The hue bar works similar to a color wheel. Red fades into orange on one side, and then to yellow. On the other side, it fades into purple, blue, cyan, and so on. Because of this, the two endpoints, -180 and 180 will be almost the same hue. Keep changing the slider until you have found a hue that you like. Click okay on the HSB menu to save. The HSB menu will close after you press okay, but you can open it again with Ctrl+U. Allow the picture to change its hue. The image itself should retain the hue that you chose, and the navigation window and layers will update as well.
